title: ISic000995. Epitaph for Tertyllanos
body:
Facsimile Images

ἀπέθανεν
Τερτυλλαν(ὸς)
διάκ(ονος) κανδελ-
αύρου ἐτ(ῶν) απ´

Apparatus criticus

Text after Rizzone, except for line 1 ; Wessel, Rizzone: ὀπεθανεν

translation

commentary

The text is currently unlocated (the Siracusa inventory states that it was transferred to Lentini Museum). Rizzone 2016 after Clarke 2014 demonstrates that the text comes from Cava Ispica, and not from Siracusa. The text requires fresh consideration, as both the surviving transcriptions from autopsy by Hoare in the 18th (see Clarke) and Orsi in the 19th centuries favour the reading proposed by Fuhrer for lines 3-4.

  • Orsi 2018 Tacc. 1, p. 90 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002617
  • Clarke 2014 28 (second column, fourth entry) https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002075
  • Rizzone 2016 234-238 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001630
  • 313 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000394
  • Strazzulla 1897 133 no. 151 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001390
  • Führer 1897 145 (815) https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002576
